comments: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p^(4[e/4]). - _Mitch Harris_, Apr 19 2005
links: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = A000188(A000188(n))^4.Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p^(4[e/4]).Dirichlet g.f.: zeta(s) * zeta(4s-4) / zeta(4s). - _√Ålvar Ibeas_, Feb 12 2015
mathematica: Max@ Select[Divisors@ #, IntegerQ@ Power[#, 1/4] &] & /@ Range@ 81 (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 18 2015 *)
prog: (PARI) a(n) = {f = factor(n); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,2] = 4*(f[i,2]\4);); factorback(f);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Mar 16 2015
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
extensions: Entry improved by comments from _Henry Bottomley_, Feb 29 2000
